Oh, I don't know if I agree with you.
ko: 어, 네 말에 동의하는지 잘 모르겠어.

en: I don't get it.
There seems to be no need to go.
I think I'd better stay here.
ko: 나 여기 있는 게 나을 것 같아.

en: I get the feeling you still have an axe to grind. If you've got something to say come on out and say it.
ko: 너 아직 앙금 남은 것 같은데, 할 말 있으면 그냥 속 시원하게 다 해 봐.

en: I am not feeling quite up to par.
I'm afraid it will rain.
Corn is an important crop in the United States.
Something is wrong with this word processor.
That's very kind of you.
It seems that something is wrong with the computer.
ko: 컴퓨터가 어디 좀 고장 난 것 같아.

en: That is a fine excuse.
I feel that I don't really belong here.
ko: 난 여기랑 잘 안 맞는 것 같아.

en: Hi, I'm Taro Kawaguchi.
Something seems to be wrong with my stomach.
I'm just looking, thank you.
I'm not too clear about that point.
ko: 그 부분은 잘 이해가 안 가.

en: This will do for the time being.
We gained access to the house through the window.
ko: 우린 창문을 통해서 집 안으로 들어갔어.

en: I managed to make the teacher understand my idea.
I managed to finish the book.
Can you possibly help me?
ko: 혹시 나 좀 도와줄 수 있어?

en: I need to get there soon by any means.
ko: 어떻게 해서든 곧 거기 도착해야 해.

en: I can play the piano after a fashion.
ko: 피아노 그냥저냥 조금 칠 줄 알아.

en: At last, she hit on a good idea.
After all she did not come.
At last she got a job as a stewardess.
Finally the children saw a little orchard in the middle of the mountain with apple trees growing inside it.
ko: 드디어 아이들은 산 중턱에 사과나무가 자라고 있는 작은 과수원을 발견했어.

en: Finally they gave in to their enemy.
At last he unfolded his plans for their future.
ko: 마침내 그는 미래를 위한 계획을 털어놓았어.

en: He was put to death finally.
At last he could finish the work.
ko: 마침내 그는 그 일을 끝낼 수 있었어.

en: At last he appeared.
It seems that the rainy season is over at last.
We have been completely cornered.
At last, the truth was revealed to us.
I have finally finished my homework; now I can go to bed.
ko: 드디어 숙제 다 끝냈다. 이제 잘 수 있어.

en: At length, we reached the top of the mountain.
ko: 한참 만에 우린 산 정상에 도착했어.

en: At last, we succeeded in solving the question.
ko: 마침내 우린 그 문제를 해결하는 데 성공했어.

en: At length, my wish was realized.
Finally, my sister got engaged.
Finally, my sister got married.
At last we can afford a house.
We finally got rid of our old car.
At last, we reached California.
At last, the day has arrived for us to act.
Summer seems to have come at last.
At last the rats came to the river.
At last, the baby fell asleep.
Eventually the salesman persuaded me to buy the expensive machine.
ko: 결국 판매원한테 설득당해서 그 비싼 기계를 사고 말았어.

en: It seems to have worn out.
At last a good idea struck me.
In the end, because of the disease, he became unable to walk and had to use a motorized wheelchair to get around.
ko: 결국 그는 병 때문에 걷지 못하게 됐고, 전동 휠체어를 타고 다녀야 했어.

en: Finally, she chose another kitten.
ko: 결국 걔는 다른 새끼 고양이를 골랐어.

en: I can't work at all with all these useless calls coming in.
ko: 쓸데없는 전화가 자꾸 와서 일을 하나도 못 하겠어.
